advantages.title: Economic Growth and Job Opportunities
advantages.description: MNCs often invest heavily in the country of operation, which usually leads to economic growth and job creation. Corporations can supply subsidiaries, factories, and offices; therefore, improving local economies and decreasing unemployment rates.

advantages.title: Access to Global Markets
advantages.description: MNCs are able to access markets in multiple countries, allowing them to increase their customer base and grow sales. Higher revenue & profits will also benefit local economies.

advantages.title: Competitive Market
advantages.description: MNCs can foster a competitive market in the country of operation, which helps with improving product quality, lowering prices, and providing more options for consumers.

advantages.title: Resource Optimization
advantages.description: MNCs can use both natural and human resources from several parts of the world, this helps with resource efficiency and can reduce the cost of production.

advantages.title: Supply Chain
advantages.description: MNCs can help connect different parts of the world, facilitating the transportation of goods and services.

disadvantages.title: Tax Avoidance
disadvantages.description: MNCs often operate in such a way that use legal loopholes to help them minimize tax obligations. This can severely impact the country of operation in terms of economic growth.

disadvantages.title: Loss of Sovereignty
disadvantages.description: MNCs can provide so much economic help that the country of operation becomes heavily reliant on the MNC. This can lead to the MNC having excessive power over government decisions. Oil-dependent nations are good examples of loss of sovereignty.

disadvantages.title: Monopolistic Behavior
disadvantages.description: MNCs are usually extremely well-funded. By selling their goods in a country with a smaller economy, MNCs can easily overwhelm other businesses with cheaper and better quality products, making them a monopoly.

disadvantages.title: Resource Exploitation
disadvantages.description: Many MNCs have been criticized for exploiting human labour by paying low wages, providing poor working conditions, and ignoring labour rights. These are ethical concerns that plenty of MNCs have received backlash for.

disadvantages.title: Cultural Impacts
disadvantages.description: MNCs can severely impact cultures of local cultures. The culture of the MNC's origin is usually brought with it to countries abroad. Their practices and culture can be detrimental to the local area.
